main_definition: A path or direction along which someone or something moves, travels, or progresses; also refers to a sequence of topics in a lecture or study.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Direction or path followed by an object or person
meanings_and_examples.example: The river took a sharp course that was difficult for the boats to navigate.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A series of lectures, meetings, or other educational sessions on a particular topic
meanings_and_examples.example: She is taking an art history course this semester.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An animal's path through the landscape during migration
meanings_and_examples.example: The geese followed their natural instinct to fly north in a V-shaped course.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A food or drink item as part of a meal, especially one served at breakfast
meanings_and_examples.example: I had eggs and bacon for my course this morning.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An amount or level of something that continues indefinitely; also refers to the flow of water
meanings_and_examples.example: The steady course of the river eroded the banks over time.
